cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles east of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move north-northeast, then turn northeast Monday, paralleling the U.S. East Coast and passing near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks before accelerating seaward toward the waters off New Jersey and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal approach near Cape Hatteras / Outer Banks, North Carolina (no direct landfall currently expected)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City, NC to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida northward through the southeast and mid-Atlantic coasts, including New Jersey and the southern New England offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Tuesday with occasional gusts 20–30 mph; tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) probability only 3%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port; water levels on the Delaware River should remain near normal astronomical tide levels
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible Tuesday into early Wednesday, generally less than 1 inch total
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along nearby New Jersey and Delaware beaches may affect maritime pilot transfers and small craft operations
